title: Lunch at Els Quatre Gats
summary: Take your time to feel the weight of this historical treasure, you are walking on the same floors that many historical art figures once walked. The cafe became a famously popular meeting place for famous artists throughout the modernist period in Catalonia, known as Modernisme. The café opened on June 12, 1897 in the famous Casa Martí, and served as a hostel, bar and cabaret until it eventually became a central meeting point for Barcelona’s most prominent modernist figures, such as Pablo Picasso and Ramon Casas i Carbó.

itinerary_title: Family Fun at Costa Dorada PortAventura Theme Park

title: Casa Mila "La Pedrera"
summary: Right up the street is La Pedrera. It's worth it to spend a little extra time here to explore the Gaudi Museum and period apartment simulacrum. The roof, with its cubist chimneys and paths that dip and pivot vertiginously, is a true wonder.

title: Restaurant Hostal Abat Cisneros
adress: Monasterio de Montserrat, Plaza del Monasterio, s/n, 08199 Montserrat, Barcelona
price: Set lunch (VAT not included): approx. 27,50 € Average price of à la carte lunch or dinner: approx. 35,00 € From 12:30 pm to 3:30 pm
summary: Restaurant Hostal Abat Cisneros offers a set menu, 3 course meal. The ceiling in the dinning room is made of stone, and was used as a stable in the16th century. It's tranquil and rustic, the perfect setting to recuperate and eat some food. I would reccomend booking in advance just in case.

title: Carry on shopping down Passeig de Gracia
adress: Passeig de Gracia, Dreta de L'Eixample
summary: I got a new suit at Bel y Cia.

title: The Pans Club for Lunch
summary: Large quiches, simple and healthy food. Leave El Borne and cross the Gothic quarter in the direction of the Cathedral of Barcelona and get lost in the streets and try to find the hidden gems of graffiti.

title: Camp Nou Football Match
summary: Had a fantastic time! The kids loved it, and so did I. Worth spending a little extra to see the smile on both my kids faces. An experience of a lifetime.

title: Plaça del Sol
summary: Food is super cheap, the only reason it's so expensive is because we stayed and kept ordering canyas (beers) :L Really cool square, people come and sit with their own beers and chill in the sun. Super Guay!

title: Restaurante Blai 56
summary: 1 Beer, 1 Pincho

title: Lunch at Els Quatre Gats
summary: Take your time to feel the weight of this historical treasure, you are walking on the same floors that many historical art figures once walked. The cafe became a famously popular meeting place for famous artists throughout the modernist period in Catalonia, known as Modernisme. The café opened on June 12, 1897 in the famous Casa Martí, and served as a hostel, bar and cabaret until it eventually became a central meeting point for Barcelona’s most prominent modernist figures, such as Pablo Picasso and Ramon Casas i Carbó.

title: La Dolce Vitae
summary: Great Sangria

title: Restaurant Victoria Bar
adress: Passeig del Mar, 23, 17320 Tossa de Mar, Girona
summary: Enjoy a Paella and a beer.

title: Restaurante Castell Vell
adress: Plaça del Pintor Roig i Soler, 17320 Tossa de Mar, Girona
summary: Really nice lunch, traditional mediterranean restaurant.

title: Fragata for Lunch
adress: Passeig de la Ribera, 1, 08870 Sitges, Barcelona
summary: Gorgeous Catalan and Mediterranean food, fabulous wine, would definitely recommend it!

title: Racó de la Calma
summary: The architecture around the old town of Sitges is so refreshing, I loved losing myself down the little quaint streets.

title: Quarré
summary: Nice restaurant, has a great view of the Brandenburg Gate while you eat.

title: Seoul Kitchen BBQ Restaurant
summary: Korean food, we both loved the fact the meat was cooked right infront of us.

title: Gartine for Lunch
summary: Antique-filled cafe for lunch, pretty tasty.

title: Gartine for Lunch
summary: Antique-filled cafe for lunch, pretty tasty.

title: Vondelpark
summary: Expansive, 19th-century urban park with a playground, ponds & an open-air theater.

itinerary_title: A short time with Lisbon wine
Paris without wine is not fine.
title: Bus to Le Marais
summary: Aprox 45 minutes to Le Marais Hotel on bus number 69. Every ten minutes or so.

title: Capitol Lounge
adress: 1 Aungier St, Dublin 2, D02 HF72, Ireland
summary: Good cocktails and cute Irish guys, perfect for after dinner ;)

title: The Stag's Head
adress: 1 Dame Ct, Dublin, D02 TW84, Ireland
summary: Absolute class pub!

title: Iguana Bar & Grill
summary: Enchiladas, burritos & tequila menu in high-ceilinged restaurant, with colourful Mexican poster art.

title: Walking across the Charles Bridge
summary: Constructed around the 15th century, the Charles Bridge is a historic bridge crossing the Vltava river.

title: KM de Pizza
summary: Very good pizza, a little overpriced but probably because of how close it is to the stadium.

title: Caravaggio’s Paintings in the Contarelli Chapel
adress: Church of St. Louis of the French Piazza di S. Luigi de' Francesi, 00186 Roma RM, Italy
summary: Caravaggio is one of the most celebrated Baroque painters in Italian history; he was a radical innovator that painted dramatic scenes and expertly employed the chiaroscuro technique, strongly contrasting light and dark to create multidimensional works of art with a strong base in naturalism.

title: Park Villa Borghese
adress: Piazzale Napoleone I, 00197 Roma RM, Italy
summary: Take a stroll around this exquisite site, filled with stunning pieces, free to peruse and admire whilst enjoying nature at it's finest.
